duties_responsibilities.duty: Provide therapeutic and counseling programs and services for assigned individuals, including individual and group therapy sessions.
Conduct student assessments and evaluations to determine abilities and needs with regard to cognitive, behavioral, social, and emotional development.
Develop therapy plans, activities, and experiences which address identified goals and objectives.
Prepare materials for planned activities and therapy sessions; conduct individual and group therapy sessions.
Collect and record behavioral and progress-related data obtained from therapy sessions and activities.
Consult with supervisors, academic peers, and other staff relating to individual treatment plans and needs.
Provide clinical supervision to non-licensed therapists; assist in developing action plans for pursuing licensure.
Implement crisis intervention strategies as needed; document and report all incidents in accordance with policies and procedures.
Maintain open communications and provide information and interpretations to parents, guardians, and other agencies regarding individual progress, needs, and treatment plans.
Participate in a variety of meetings and committees such as treatment planning meetings, staff meetings, etc.
Provide program-related training to staff as requested.

education_certification.credential: Master's degree in counseling, psychology, or social work.
